Statement: I keep in touch with major developments in my field and with opportunities for innovation in my organisation/ project/ system
I like to come up with innovative solutions to difficult problems
When faced with tough work-related problems, instead of turning to stock solutions and tried and trusted methods, I seek novel or off beat solutions
I feel impatient with traditional or conventional solutions to work related problems
I have a fine sense of timing when it comes to introducing innovations/ changes
I can quickly identify the power structure of the organisation or system and learn what powerful people in the system want or don't want
I am good at roping in influential people to support my ideas
I can quickly identify the do's and don'ts'  of the organisation or system
I keep in touch with a wide variety of people and consciously develop a large number of informative and influential contacts
In getting jobs done, I have a knack for doing the right thing at the right time
I am not intimidated or overawed by big people and big bosses
I take work related criticism or failure positively
I remain cool even during a big occasion
I do not get disheartened in a tight  corner, and quickly try to find a way out of it
I do not get unnerved even if hard choices have to be made
I generally think up first many and varied alternatives before evaluating any of them
I think through several alternative courses of action before deciding
I can bring order even to the most messy work situation by systematic analysis
I carefully map out all the steps of a solution or course of action
I can mobilize necessary resources for a task even when resources are scarce
I am quick at spotting projects that are beneficial to the organization
I have a knack for building an effective team for implementing a new project/ activity
While implementing a project I give credit liberally to those making a positive contribution
I get new projects going easily and quickly
I have a knack for making persuasive presentations for proposals for new projects/activities
I can be counted upon to play my part in getting a job done
I  set demanding work related goals or targets, and strict deadlines for meeting the goals or target
I seek and accept personal responsibility for getting a job done
I follow up on tasks and get them efficiently executed
I put out best and expect to come out way ahead of others
I quite easily put myself into the shoes of others and sense their feelings and moods
Others at work turn to me in their moments of emotional distress
I am a patient listener and rarely judge others without fully understanding what they are trying to say
I generally give to others a correct picture of my thoughts and feelings to put them at ease
I encourage colleagues to express their feelings and voice their objections to proposals
I am at ease with most people and enjoy close working relationships
I get colleagues and subordinates to participate in decision making
I can inspire others and infuse them with enthusiasm for a difficult task
I can visualize big goals and get people excited for a difficult task
I am good at building a high performance team for pursuing challenging goals
I am quite aware of ethical issues in any problematic situations
I stick to my core ethical principles when I have to make a difficult choice
I try hard to balance my self-interest with the interest of others
I do have a sense of mission in life
I try hard to get my organisation to pursue social responsibility
I dislike unfamiliar situations.
If you don’t plan your holidays in detail, you just end up wasting time and money.
I prefer a boss who tells me precisely what I am supposed to do.
Giving in to the pleasures of the body detracts from high thinking.
I hate confusion.
There is a great danger in giving up our old customs and traditions.
Parents know best what occupations their children should pursue.
Women should not dress like men and vice versa.
Premarital sex is immoral.
One must fulfil one’s social obligations at any cost.
I prefer to give up when I hear that a task is too difficult.
I don’t like to compete with strong opponents.
I dislike being compared to others.
I hate to lose at games.
In a meeting, I don’t speak up unless I am an expert on a point.
I like to make friends mostly with those who appreciate me.
I really dislike any criticism levelled against me.
I dislike subordinates trying to be familiar with me.
I feel tense communicating with persons who have greater authority than I.
I don’t like being contradicted in the presence of others.
I don’t think I have any very distinctive skills outside my area of specialization.
At work or studies, I generally don’t share problems with colleagues to seek their guidance.
I don’t think Third World countries have the resources to catch up with the First.
I don’t think I can do well in a job or occupation very different from my present one.
One can accomplish little without the support of the authorities.
I can predict the behaviour of a person if I know his social background.
You can make out what people are like by noticing the way they dress.
I am more comfortable after I have classified a person.
Necessities must always have priority over artistic matters.
People in the same profession have similar personalities.
You can’t be called mature unless you can really control your emotions.
I resist expressing tenderness towards others.
I rather dislike sad movies.
I have very little interest in flower arrangements and the like.
No matter what choice of food I have in a restaurant, I like to order the same old favourites.
I can’t stand meetings without a clear prior agenda.
I have never bothered myself with modern art.
I can’t be bothered with questions such as “What would happen if birds had brains like humans and humans had wings like birds?”.
A pound of imagination is not worth an ounce of facts.
I don’t like to see serious plays or movies
